medicines.summary: A common over-the-counter medication to reduce fever and relieve mild to moderate pain by blocking pain and fever signals in the brain.
A combination antibiotic that treats bacterial infections. Amoxycillin kills bacteria, while Clavulanic Acid prevents the bacteria from deactivating the Amoxycillin.
A non-drowsy antihistamine that provides relief from allergy symptoms by blocking the effects of histamine in the body.

causes_for_use: Nausea and vomiting associated with acidity
medicines.summary: A combination medication for acidity and reflux. Pantoprazole reduces stomach acid production, and Domperidone helps in the proper movement of food to prevent reflux and nausea.

causes_for_use: Mild to moderate pain (headache, toothache, muscle pain)
medicines.summary: A combination of a pain reliever (Paracetamol) and an anti-inflammatory drug (Ibuprofen). It effectively reduces pain, inflammation, and fever.

causes_for_use: Management of high blood sugar in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
medicines.summary: An anti-diabetic medication that combines two drugs. Metformin reduces glucose production and improves insulin sensitivity, while Glimepiride stimulates the pancreas to release more insulin.
A calcium channel blocker used to treat high blood pressure and prevent angina. It relaxes blood vessels, making it easier for the heart to pump blood.

causes_for_use: Prevention of cardiovascular diseases like heart attack and stroke
medicines.summary: Belongs to a group of medicines called statins. It works by reducing the amount of 'bad' cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides in the blood, while increasing the levels of 'good' cholesterol (HDL).

causes_for_use: Reducing the risk of heart attack and stroke in high-risk patients
medicines.summary: An angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB). It relaxes blood vessels, which lowers blood pressure and makes it easier for the heart to pump blood. It is also used for heart protection in certain patients.

causes_for_use: Blood thinner to prevent blood clots
Prevention of heart attacks and strokes
Used after stent placement or bypass surgery
medicines.summary: A low-dose aspirin medication that acts as an antiplatelet agent, or blood thinner. It prevents platelets in the blood from clumping together and forming harmful clots, thereby reducing the risk of heart attacks and strokes.

A combination medicine used to relieve allergy symptoms and prevent asthma. Levocetirizine is an antihistamine that blocks histamine. Montelukast blocks another substance called leukotriene, which helps reduce inflammation in the airways and nose.
A fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat a wide range of serious bacterial infections. It works by stopping the growth and multiplication of bacteria. It is ineffective against viral infections.
A synthetic thyroid hormone used to replace the natural hormone when the body does not produce enough. It helps regulate the body's energy and metabolism.

An antidepressant belonging to the SSRI (Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitor) class. It works by increasing the levels of serotonin, a chemical messenger in the brain, which helps improve mood and relieve symptoms of depression and anxiety.
A benzodiazepine that works by enhancing the activity of a calming chemical messenger in the brain (GABA). It is used for short-term relief of severe anxiety and to control seizures.

A combination painkiller for pain that is not relieved by other analgesics. Paracetamol is a pain reliever, while Tramadol is a mild opioid analgesic that works on the central nervous system to block pain signals.

causes_for_use: Fungal infections (e.g., vaginal yeast infections, oral thrush)
medicines.summary: An antifungal medication used to treat a variety of fungal and yeast infections. It works by stopping the growth of the fungus.

causes_for_use: Kidney stones caused by high uric acid levels
medicines.summary: Used to prevent gout attacks by reducing the production of uric acid in the body. It is not a painkiller and does not relieve an active gout attack, but is used for long-term management.

causes_for_use: Stiffness in muscles associated with spine or joint disorders
medicines.summary: A muscle relaxant used to relieve pain and stiffness from muscle spasms. It acts on the brain and spinal cord to relieve muscle stiffness without reducing muscle strength.
A corticosteroid that works by reducing inflammation and suppressing the immune system. It is used to treat a wide range of inflammatory and allergic conditions.

causes_for_use: Often used to prevent nausea from chemotherapy, radiation, or surgery
medicines.summary: An antiemetic medication that blocks the action of serotonin, a natural substance in the body that can cause nausea and vomiting.
An anti-vertigo medicine that is thought to work by improving blood flow in the inner ear, which helps reduce the symptoms of Meniere's disease.

causes_for_use: Intestinal worm infections (e.g., pinworm, roundworm, hookworm)
medicines.summary: An anthelmintic medicine used to treat infections caused by various parasitic worms. It works by preventing the worms from absorbing sugar, causing them to lose energy and die.

causes_for_use: Bacterial infections of the stomach, liver, skin, and vagina
Amoebic dysentery and other protozoprotozoal infections
medicines.summary: An antibiotic and antiprotozoal medication effective against anaerobic bacteria and certain parasites. It works by stopping the growth of these infectious organisms.

causes_for_use: Management of high blood sugar in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
medicines.summary: An oral diabetes medicine that helps control blood sugar levels. It works by increasing levels of natural substances called incretins, which help to control blood sugar by increasing insulin release and decreasing the amount of sugar made by the liver.

A beta-blocker that affects the heart and circulation. It works by blocking the action of certain natural chemicals in your body, such as epinephrine, on the heart and blood vessels. This effect lowers heart rate, blood pressure, and strain on the heart.

causes_for_use: Edema (fluid retention) associated with heart failure, liver or kidney disease
medicines.summary: A loop diuretic (water pill) that prevents your body from absorbing too much salt, allowing the salt to instead be passed in your urine. This helps reduce fluid retention and can also lower blood pressure.

A combination supplement used to treat or prevent low blood levels of iron and folic acid. Iron is crucial for producing red blood cells, and folic acid is important for fetal development and cell growth.

causes_for_use: Used as a supplement in osteoporosis
medicines.summary: A high-dose Vitamin D supplement, typically taken once a week. Vitamin D is essential for the absorption of calcium and phosphorus, which are vital for building and maintaining strong bones.

causes_for_use: Prevention of heart attack and stroke
medicines.summary: An antiplatelet medicine or blood thinner that helps prevent the formation of harmful blood clots in blood vessels.
A statin medication used to lower 'bad' cholesterol (LDL) and fats (triglycerides) and raise 'good' cholesterol (HDL) in the blood.
A beta-blocker that works by blocking the action of certain natural chemicals in your body on the heart and blood vessels, which lowers heart rate and blood pressure.
An angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB) that helps to relax blood vessels, lowering blood pressure and making it easier for the heart to pump blood.
A combination of two oral anti-diabetic medicines to control high blood sugar. Sitagliptin helps raise insulin levels after meals while Metformin lowers sugar production in the liver.
A sulfonylurea drug that helps the pancreas produce more insulin to lower blood sugar levels.
A combination drug that improves blood sugar control. Vildagliptin works by increasing incretins and Metformin reduces glucose production by the liver.
A DPP-4 inhibitor, which is an oral diabetes medicine that helps control blood sugar levels by increasing insulin release and decreasing sugar production.
An SGLT2 inhibitor that works by helping the kidneys get rid of glucose from the bloodstream through the urine, thereby lowering blood sugar levels.
A dietary supplement used to prevent or treat low blood calcium levels. Vitamin D3 is included to help the body absorb calcium.

medicines.active_ingredient: Vitamin B complex (B1, B2, B3, B5, B6, B12)
medicines.summary: A multivitamin supplement containing a mixture of B vitamins used to treat or prevent vitamin deficiency due to poor diet, certain illnesses, or alcoholism.
A popular Ayurvedic formulation that is claimed to protect the liver against various hepatotoxins and promote liver health.
A daily health supplement that combines vitamins, minerals, and ginseng to help maintain energy levels, support the immune system, and improve mental alertness.
A combination medicine used to relieve colicky pain and cramps. Dicyclomine is an antispasmodic, and Paracetamol is a pain reliever.
A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that works by blocking the release of certain chemical messengers that cause pain and inflammation.
A combination of two medicines: Aceclofenac, an NSAID, and Paracetamol, an analgesic-antipyretic. It is used for pain relief in various conditions.
A combination drug used to relieve spasmodic pain and cramps. Mefenamic Acid is an NSAID, and Dicyclomine is an antispasmodic.
A macrolide antibiotic that fights bacteria. It is often used for short-course treatments due to its long half-life.
A third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic that is used to treat a wide variety of bacterial infections.
A tetracycline antibiotic that treats bacterial infections. It includes Lactic Acid Bacillus to maintain healthy gut flora.

causes_for_use: Bacterial infections of the urinary tract, respiratory tract, and gastrointestinal system
medicines.summary: A fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections. It works by stopping the multiplication of bacteria.
A popular brand of the Amoxycillin and Clavulanic Acid combination antibiotic, used to treat a wide range of bacterial infections.

causes_for_use: Herpes simplex virus infections (cold sores, genital herpes)
medicines.summary: An antiviral drug that slows the growth and spread of the herpes virus in the body. It does not cure herpes, but can lessen the symptoms of the infection.

causes_for_use: Short-term management of moderate to severe pain
medicines.summary: A potent nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used for short-term pain relief, often after surgery. It is available as a dispersible tablet.
A bronchodilator medication that relaxes the muscles in the airways, making it easier to breathe.
A fast-acting 'reliever' or 'rescue' inhaler used to quickly treat wheezing and shortness of breath caused by breathing problems like asthma.

causes_for_use: Long-term control of Asthma and COPD
medicines.summary: A combination 'preventer' inhaler. Salmeterol is a long-acting bronchodilator, and Fluticasone is a corticosteroid that reduces inflammation.
An inhaled corticosteroid ('preventer') that reduces irritation and swelling in the airways to prevent asthma attacks from occurring.
A bronchodilator similar to Salbutamol, used as a 'reliever' inhaler. It is a specific isomer of Salbutamol, which may cause fewer side effects for some people.
A thienodiazepine drug, which is similar to benzodiazepines. It acts as an anxiolytic and sedative, used for short-term treatment of anxiety and sleep disorders.
A sedative-hypnotic medication used to help people fall asleep. It is intended for short-term use only.
A widely used antidepressant of the SSRI class. It works by increasing serotonin levels in the brain to improve mood and reduce anxiety.
An atypical antipsychotic medication used to treat certain mental/mood disorders by helping to restore the balance of certain natural substances in the brain.
An anticonvulsant medication used to treat seizures by decreasing abnormal electrical activity in the brain.
An anti-epileptic drug that is also very commonly used to relieve nerve pain, such as that caused by shingles or diabetic neuropathy.

A combination medication used to treat the symptoms of Parkinson's disease, such as stiffness and tremors. Levodopa is converted to dopamine in the brain, while Carbidopa prevents Levodopa from being broken down before it reaches the brain.
An H2 blocker that works by decreasing the amount of acid the stomach produces, providing relief from heartburn and indigestion.
A liquid antacid that works by neutralizing excess stomach acid. Simethicone is added to help break up gas bubbles in the gut.

medicines.active_ingredient: Magnesium Hydroxide + Simethicone + Magnesium Aluminium Silicate + Dried Aluminium Hydroxide
medicines.summary: A popular brand of chewable antacid tablets that provide quick relief from acidity and gas by neutralizing stomach acid.
An anti-diarrheal medication that works by slowing down the movement of the gut, which decreases the number of bowel movements and makes the stool less watery.

causes_for_use: Diarrhea and dysentery caused by bacterial and protozoal infections
medicines.summary: A combination of an antibiotic (Norfloxacin) and an antiprotozoal (Tinidazole) used to treat mixed gastrointestinal infections.
An alpha-blocker that helps to relax the muscles in the prostate and bladder neck, making it easier to urinate for men with an enlarged prostate.
A medication used to treat hair loss in men by blocking the body's production of a male hormone (DHT) in the scalp that stops hair growth.
A PDE5 inhibitor, sold under various brand names like Viagra, that works by increasing blood flow to the penis to help a man get and keep an erection.
A synthetic progestogen, similar to the natural hormone progesterone. It is used to regulate the menstrual cycle and support pregnancy.
An ovulation stimulant used to treat infertility in women who are not ovulating properly.
An emergency contraceptive pill that contains a high dose of a progestin hormone to prevent pregnancy after unprotected intercourse or contraceptive failure.

causes_for_use: Antiseptic for cuts, wounds, and burns
medicines.summary: A broad-spectrum antiseptic solution or ointment applied to the skin to prevent infection in minor cuts, scrapes, and burns.

causes_for_use: Infected and inflamed skin conditions like eczema
medicines.summary: A combination topical cream containing a steroid (Betamethasone) to reduce inflammation and an antibiotic (Neomycin) to treat bacterial infection.

causes_for_use: Mixed fungal and bacterial skin infections with inflammation
medicines.summary: A combination cream with a steroid, an antifungal (Clotrimazole), and an antibiotic for complex skin infections.

causes_for_use: Fungal skin infections with itching or inflammation
medicines.summary: A combination cream containing an antifungal (Clotrimazole) and a steroid (Beclomethasone) to treat fungal infections and relieve associated itching.
A potent combination cream with a strong steroid, antifungal, antibiotic, and a soothing agent for severe skin conditions.
A topical antibiotic cream used to treat a variety of bacterial skin infections and to prevent infection in burns and wounds.
A topical antibiotic that is particularly effective against certain types of bacteria, such as Staphylococcus and Streptococcus, that cause skin infections.
Antibiotic eye drops used to treat bacterial infections of the eye.
Lubricating eye drops, also known as artificial tears, used to relieve dryness and irritation of the eye.
A beta-blocker in the form of eye drops used to treat high pressure inside the eye due to glaucoma or ocular hypertension.
A decongestant nasal spray that provides fast and temporary relief from a blocked nose caused by colds, sinusitis, or allergies.
An older, first-generation antihistamine that is effective for allergies but often causes drowsiness.
A second-generation antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms. It is less sedating than older antihistamines but can still cause drowsiness in some people.
A pain-relieving medication that combines Paracetamol with Caffeine, which helps to increase the effectiveness of the Paracetamol.

causes_for_use: Common cold symptoms (pain, fever, congestion, runny nose)
medicines.summary: A combination medicine for cold and flu that contains a pain reliever/fever reducer, a decongestant, and an antihistamine.
An over-the-counter remedy for cold symptoms, providing relief from headache, nasal congestion, and body aches.
A combination cough syrup containing a cough suppressant, an antihistamine, and expectorants to help loosen mucus.
A cough syrup containing a sedating antihistamine that helps relieve coughing and other cold symptoms.

causes_for_use: Prevention of neural tube defects in pregnancy
medicines.summary: A Vitamin B9 supplement that is essential for producing and maintaining new cells, and is particularly important during pregnancy.
An ACE inhibitor that works by relaxing blood vessels to lower blood pressure and reduce the workload on the heart.
A non-selective beta-blocker used for various cardiovascular conditions and also to manage physical symptoms of anxiety.

causes_for_use: Prevention and treatment of blood clots (e.g., DVT, PE)
medicines.summary: An anticoagulant (blood thinner) that helps to prevent blood clots. Its use requires careful monitoring through regular blood tests (INR).
A digestive supplement containing enzymes to help break down food and activated charcoal to absorb gas.
A combination drug that helps treat stomach and intestinal problems by reducing stomach acid, slowing the gut, and reducing anxiety.
A corticosteroid used to treat inflammation. It is sometimes considered to have fewer side effects than other steroids like prednisolone.
A disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) that reduces inflammation and pain in autoimmune conditions.
A supplement containing calcium, an active form of Vitamin D (Calcitriol) for better absorption, and Zinc for bone health.
A widely used Proton Pump Inhibitor (PPI) that provides long-lasting reduction of stomach acid production.
A combination of a PPI (Rabeprazole) and a prokinetic agent (Domperidone) for treating acid reflux and its symptoms like nausea.
A topical NSAID gel that provides localized relief from pain and inflammation by being absorbed through the skin.
A topical pain relief spray that combines an NSAID with cooling and warming agents for quick pain relief.

medicines.active_ingredient: Herbal oils (Turpentine oil, Nilgiri oil, Wintergreen oil, Mint)
medicines.summary: A popular herbal topical analgesic ointment that provides a warming sensation and relief from muscular and joint aches.
A high-dose, once-a-week Vitamin D supplement used to treat deficiency and improve bone health.
A combination of two medicines used for medical abortion during the early stages of pregnancy, to be used strictly under medical supervision.
A popular brand of the cephalosporin antibiotic Cefixime, used for infections of the urinary tract, throat, and lungs.
A cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat infections like bronchitis, pneumonia, and infections of the skin, ear, and urinary tract.
A broad-spectrum fluoroquinolone antibiotic used for treating a number of bacterial infections.
An ACE inhibitor used to treat high blood pressure and congestive heart failure.
An alpha-blocker used to relax blood vessels to treat hypertension and also to relax muscles in the prostate for BPH.
A combination inhaler containing two bronchodilators that work in different ways to open up the airways.

causes_for_use: Maintenance treatment of Asthma and COPD
medicines.summary: A combination 'preventer' inhaler with a long-acting bronchodilator (Formoterol) and a corticosteroid (Budesonide).
A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain from various conditions like headache, muscle aches, and arthritis.
An anticonvulsant and analgesic drug used to treat nerve pain caused by conditions like diabetes or shingles, as well as fibromyalgia.
A high-dose calcium and Vitamin D3 supplement used to support bone health.

medicines.active_ingredient: Vitamin B Complex + Vitamin C + Zinc
medicines.summary: A multivitamin supplement that provides essential B-complex vitamins, Vitamin C, and Zinc to boost immunity and overall health.
An antiemetic medication that is effective in controlling nausea and vomiting. It is often provided as a mouth-dissolving (MD) tablet for faster action.
A Proton Pump Inhibitor (PPI) that reduces the amount of acid produced in the stomach.
An Ayurvedic formulation claimed to help prevent the formation of kidney stones and assist in their expulsion.
A topical herbal ointment that helps to shrink pile mass, control bleeding and heal inflamed skin, providing relief from rectal bleeding, pain, and itchiness.
An osmotic laxative that works by drawing water into the bowel to soften stools and make them easier to pass.

medicines.active_ingredient: Liquid Paraffin + Magnesium Hydroxide + Sodium Picosulfate
medicines.summary: A combination laxative that works in three ways: as a lubricant, an osmotic laxative, and a stimulant to provide relief from constipation.
An anti-parasitic medication used to treat infections caused by certain parasites.

causes_for_use: Mild to moderate COVID-19 (under specific medical guidelines)
medicines.summary: An antiviral drug that was approved for restricted emergency use in India for the treatment of COVID-19.
A rapid-acting insulin used to control high blood sugar in adults and children with diabetes mellitus. It is typically taken shortly before meals.
A long-acting insulin that provides a steady level of insulin in the body for up to 24 hours. It is usually taken once a day to manage baseline blood sugar levels.

causes_for_use: Prevention of stroke in atrial fibrillation
Prevention of blood clots after surgery
medicines.summary: A direct oral anticoagulant (DOAC) that works by blocking a specific clotting factor in the blood, used to prevent and treat harmful blood clots.

causes_for_use: Prevention of stroke in atrial fibrillation
medicines.summary: An oral anticoagulant (blood thinner) that works by inhibiting Factor Xa, a key component in the blood clotting process.

causes_for_use: Prevention of heart attack and stroke in high-risk patients
medicines.summary: An antiplatelet medication used to prevent platelets from sticking together and forming a dangerous blood clot. It is often used with aspirin.
An SGLT2 inhibitor used to lower blood sugar in adults with type 2 diabetes and also to reduce the risk of cardiovascular death in patients with heart disease.
A long-acting anticholinergic bronchodilator that helps to open up airways and make breathing easier for people with COPD or severe asthma.
An anticonvulsant medication that is also used to prevent migraine headaches by calming overactive nerve cells in the brain.
An atypical antipsychotic that works by changing the actions of chemicals in the brain. It is used to treat several different mental health conditions.
A cholinesterase inhibitor used to improve memory, awareness, and the ability to function in people with Alzheimer's disease. It does not cure the disease but can slow its progression.
A disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) and chemotherapy agent. At low doses, it treats autoimmune diseases by suppressing the immune system. At high doses, it treats cancer.
An immunosuppressant drug used to prevent organ rejection after a transplant and to treat severe autoimmune diseases.
A potent immunosuppressant used orally to prevent organ rejection and topically as an ointment to treat moderate to severe eczema.
A well-known benzodiazepine used for its calming, muscle-relaxing, and anti-seizure effects. Generally for short-term use.
A potent benzodiazepine used to treat anxiety disorders and seizure emergencies. It has strong sedative properties.
A powerful derivative of Vitamin A used to treat severe acne that has not responded to other treatments. Requires strict medical supervision due to potential side effects.

causes_for_use: Androgenetic alopecia (male and female pattern baldness)
medicines.summary: A topical solution or foam that is applied to the scalp to stimulate hair growth and to slow balding.
A medication used for the long-term management of gout. It works by decreasing the amount of uric acid in the body, an alternative to Allopurinol.
A corticosteroid nasal spray used to treat nasal symptoms such as congestion, sneezing, and runny nose caused by seasonal or year-round allergies.
A beta-blocker that is also an alpha-blocker. It is used to treat heart failure and high blood pressure by slowing the heart rate and relaxing blood vessels.
A calcium channel blocker that works by relaxing the muscles of your heart and blood vessels.
A nitrate that dilates (widens) blood vessels, making it easier for blood to flow through them and easier for the heart to pump. Used to treat and prevent chest pain.
A fast-acting nitrate used to relieve sudden attacks of chest pain (angina). It is often administered as a sublingual tablet (under the tongue) for rapid absorption.
A potent antiarrhythmic drug used to treat and prevent a number of types of irregular heartbeats when other treatments have not worked.
A cardiac glycoside that helps make the heart beat stronger and with a more regular rhythm.

causes_for_use: Prevention and treatment of DVT and PE
medicines.summary: A low molecular weight heparin (LMWH), an anticoagulant used to prevent and treat harmful blood clots. It is administered via injection.

medicines.active_ingredient: Sodium Chloride, Potassium Chloride, Sodium Citrate, Dextrose
causes_for_use: Dehydration due to diarrhea and vomiting
medicines.summary: Oral Rehydration Salts, a life-saving solution of salts and sugar mixed with water to replenish fluids and electrolytes lost during episodes of diarrhea or vomiting.
A broad-spectrum antifungal medication used to treat a wide variety of fungal infections affecting the lungs, mouth, throat, and toenails.
An antifungal medication that is particularly effective for treating fungal infections of the nails and skin.

causes_for_use: Treatment and prevention of Influenza A and B
medicines.summary: An antiviral drug used to treat the flu. It helps shorten the duration of flu symptoms if taken within 48 hours of their onset.
An antiviral drug that is converted to acyclovir in the body. It is used to treat infections caused by herpes viruses.
An antiretroviral medication used as part of combination therapy to treat HIV and to treat chronic hepatitis B.
A powerful antibiotic that is a cornerstone of treatment for tuberculosis and other mycobacterial infections.
An antibiotic used as a first-line agent in the prevention and treatment of tuberculosis.
A drug used in combination with other drugs to treat tuberculosis. It is particularly important in the initial phase of treatment.
An antibiotic that prevents the growth of tuberculosis bacteria, used as part of a multi-drug regimen.
A chemotherapy medication used to treat a number of types of cancer. It works by interfering with the normal function of microtubules during cell division.
A platinum-based chemotherapy drug used to treat various cancers. It works by interfering with DNA repair.
An anthracycline type of chemotherapy that works by slowing or stopping the growth of cancer cells.
A selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM) used to treat and prevent breast cancer in women. It works by blocking the effects of estrogen on cancer cells.

causes_for_use: Hormone receptor-positive breast cancer in postmenopausal women
medicines.summary: An aromatase inhibitor that works by decreasing the amount of estrogen produced in the body, which can slow the growth of certain types of breast tumors.
A targeted therapy drug known as a tyrosine kinase inhibitor. It works by blocking the action of an abnormal protein that signals cancer cells to multiply.
A monoclonal antibody that works by targeting a specific protein on the surface of B cells, causing them to die. Used in both cancer and autoimmune diseases.
A monoclonal antibody used as a targeted therapy for cancers that overexpress the HER2 protein. It blocks the receptor to stop cancer cells from growing.
An immunotherapy drug called a checkpoint inhibitor. It works by blocking a protein that stops the immune system from attacking cancer cells.
A highly effective immunotherapy drug (checkpoint inhibitor) that helps the body's immune system to detect and fight cancer cells.
A prostaglandin analog eye drop used to reduce pressure inside the eye by increasing the outflow of fluid from the eye.
A fluoroquinolone antibiotic in eye drop form used to treat bacterial infections of the eyes.
An antihistamine and mast cell stabilizer eye drop used to treat itching and redness in the eyes due to allergies.
A third-generation cephalosporin antibiotic administered intravenously or intramuscularly for serious infections.
A powerful combination of a broad-spectrum penicillin antibiotic and a beta-lactamase inhibitor, used for difficult-to-treat infections.
A glycopeptide antibiotic used to treat serious infections caused by Gram-positive bacteria that are resistant to other antibiotics.
A very broad-spectrum carbapenem antibiotic used for severe, multi-drug resistant bacterial infections.
A life-saving medication used in emergencies to treat severe allergic reactions by constricting blood vessels, relaxing airways, and increasing heart rate.

causes_for_use: Induction and maintenance of general anesthesia
medicines.summary: A short-acting intravenous anesthetic agent used to put patients to sleep for surgery or to sedate them in intensive care.
A potent synthetic opioid analgesic used for severe pain and as an adjunct to general anesthesia. It is significantly more potent than morphine.
A short-acting benzodiazepine used to produce sleepiness or drowsiness and to relieve anxiety before medical procedures.
A potent corticosteroid used to treat various inflammatory conditions. It is also used in the management of severe COVID-19.
An antiviral medication administered intravenously that was granted emergency use authorization for treating hospitalized patients with COVID-19.
A powerful antifungal medication reserved for serious systemic fungal infections. It can have significant side effects, particularly on the kidneys.
A simple, effective treatment for dehydration. The combination of salt and sugar helps the body absorb water and electrolytes more efficiently.
A popular nutritional supplement containing a wide range of vitamins, minerals, and an antioxidant (grape seed extract) for overall health.
An osmotic laxative powder that is mixed with water. It works by retaining water in the stool, making it softer and easier to pass.
A synthetic sugar used to treat constipation by drawing water into the bowel. It is also used in liver disease to reduce ammonia levels in the blood.
A stimulant laxative that works by increasing the movement of the intestines, helping the stool to come out.
A prokinetic and anti-emetic agent that helps to relieve nausea and feelings of fullness by increasing the movements of the stomach and intestines.
A combination medication that provides relief from spasms and pain. Dicyclomine relieves muscle cramps in the abdomen, and Paracetamol reduces pain.
An antacid gel that also contains a local anesthetic (Oxetacaine) to provide faster relief from pain caused by stomach ulcers or acid.
An anti-ulcer medication that works by forming a protective coating over an ulcer, which shields it from stomach acid and allows it to heal.
A naturally occurring bile acid used to dissolve certain types of gallstones and to treat a specific autoimmune liver disease (PBC).
An antibiotic that is poorly absorbed into the bloodstream, so it mainly works in the gut. It is used to treat various gastrointestinal conditions.
A protein supplement powder that is easily digestible and fortified with essential vitamins and minerals, used to meet nutritional needs.
A long-acting PDE5 inhibitor (similar to Sildenafil) used to treat erectile dysfunction. Lower doses can also be taken daily to manage symptoms of an enlarged prostate.
A 5-alpha-reductase inhibitor that works by preventing the conversion of testosterone to dihydrotestosterone (DHT), helping to shrink an enlarged prostate and treat hair loss.
A medication used to treat the symptoms of an overactive bladder, such as a frequent need to urinate, a sudden urge to urinate, and incontinence. It works by relaxing the bladder muscle.
An anticholinergic medication that reduces muscle spasms of the bladder and urinary tract, helping to control the symptoms of OAB.
An antibiotic that is specifically used to treat and prevent uncomplicated urinary tract infections. It works by killing bacteria in the urinary tract.

causes_for_use: Symptomatic relief of pain from UTIs
medicines.summary: A urinary tract analgesic that helps to relieve pain, burning, and urgency associated with UTIs. It does not treat the infection itself and colors the urine orange.

causes_for_use: Preventing excessive bleeding after surgery or trauma
medicines.summary: An antifibrinolytic agent that works by slowing the breakdown of blood clots, which helps to prevent prolonged bleeding.
A synthetic prostaglandin used for various purposes, including protecting the stomach lining, ripening the cervix for labor, and causing uterine contractions.
A synthetic progestin used to regulate menstrual periods and as a long-acting injectable contraceptive (Depo-Provera).
Combination hormonal pills containing estrogen and progestin that work by preventing ovulation to protect against pregnancy.
A topical antifungal cream from the azole class used to treat common fungal infections of the skin.
A third-generation topical retinoid primarily used in the treatment of mild-moderate acne. It works by affecting the growth of cells and decreasing swelling and inflammation.
A combination topical treatment for acne. Clindamycin is an antibiotic that fights bacteria, and Nicotinamide (a form of Vitamin B3) has anti-inflammatory properties.
A skin-lightening agent used to lighten areas of darkened skin. It works by decreasing the production of melanin.
A medium-potency topical corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation, itching, and redness in various skin conditions.
A soothing topical lotion that provides relief from mild itching and skin irritation. It has a drying effect and is commonly used for weeping rashes.
A topical antibacterial cream used to prevent and treat infections in second and third-degree burns.
An antifungal shampoo used to treat fungal infections on the scalp and body. It helps control flaking, scaling, and itching.
An anti-parasite medication used to treat infestations of scabies mites and lice by paralyzing and killing them.
A non-selective beta-blocker that affects the heart, blood vessels, and other parts of the body. It's used for heart conditions, migraines, and managing physical anxiety symptoms.
A tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) used to treat mood disorders. At lower doses, it is highly effective for chronic nerve pain and preventing migraines.
A serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant that is also effective in treating chronic pain conditions.
An atypical antidepressant that can also have strong sedative effects and often increases appetite, making it useful for certain patient profiles.
An atypical antipsychotic medication used to treat psychotic disorders. It is known to be effective but can cause significant weight gain.
A typical antipsychotic used to treat psychotic disorders and control tics. It is a potent medication with a higher risk of movement-related side effects.
An anticonvulsant that is also used as a mood stabilizer and for treating specific types of nerve pain.
A medication with a broad range of uses, including controlling seizures, stabilizing mood in bipolar disorder, and preventing migraines.
A widely used anti-epileptic drug known for having a favorable side-effect profile and fewer drug interactions compared to older anticonvulsants.
One of the oldest and most commonly used anticonvulsant medications. It works by slowing down impulses in the brain that cause seizures.
An anticonvulsant that is also highly effective as a mood stabilizer, particularly for preventing the depressive episodes of bipolar disorder.
A triptan medication used to relieve the symptoms of an active migraine headache. It works by narrowing blood vessels in the brain. It does not prevent migraines.
A fast-acting triptan used to treat migraine headaches once they have started. Often available as a mouth-dissolving tablet for quicker relief.
A medication used to treat the symptoms of Alzheimer's disease. It works by blocking the effects of a substance in the brain called glutamate.
A central nervous system stimulant used to treat ADHD by increasing attention and decreasing restlessness. It is a controlled substance.
A non-stimulant medication used to treat ADHD. It works by affecting neurotransmitters in the brain and can be a good alternative for those who cannot take stimulants.
The most common medication for the long-term prevention of gout. It lowers uric acid levels in the blood by inhibiting its production.
An anti-inflammatory medication that is highly effective at relieving the pain and swelling of an acute gout attack.
A selective COX-2 inhibitor, a type of NSAID that is designed to be gentler on the stomach lining compared to traditional NSAIDs.
A long-acting NSAID used to relieve pain, tenderness, swelling, and stiffness caused by arthritis.
A potent NSAID used for moderate to severe inflammatory conditions.
An NSAID used for short-term pain relief. Its use is restricted in some countries due to concerns about liver toxicity.
A proteolytic enzyme claimed to have anti-inflammatory properties. It is often combined with NSAIDs to reduce swelling, though its efficacy is debated.
A combination of enzymes used to resolve swelling and inflammation, particularly after surgery or injury.
A form of Vitamin D that does not require activation by the kidneys, making it useful for patients with kidney failure to manage calcium and bone health.

causes_for_use: High phosphate levels in kidney disease
medicines.summary: A phosphate binder used by patients on dialysis. It works by binding to phosphate from food in the gut, preventing it from being absorbed into the blood.

causes_for_use: Anemia due to chronic kidney disease
medicines.summary: A man-made version of a human hormone that stimulates the bone marrow to produce more red blood cells.
A calcium channel blocker that blocks two types of calcium channels (L-type and N-type), which not only lowers blood pressure but may also offer better protection against organ damage.
A thiazide-like diuretic (water pill) that is highly effective and long-acting for the treatment of hypertension.
A potassium-sparing diuretic that helps remove excess fluid from the body without causing potassium loss. It also has anti-androgen effects.

causes_for_use: Edema due to heart, kidney or liver failure
medicines.summary: A potent loop diuretic, similar to Furosemide, used to treat fluid overload.
A highly selective beta-blocker that also has a vasodilating effect by releasing nitric oxide, which helps to relax blood vessels.
A heart rate-lowering agent that works by specifically inhibiting the 'funny' current (If) in the heart's pacemaker, reducing heart rate without affecting blood pressure.

causes_for_use: Heart failure with reduced ejection fraction
medicines.summary: A combination drug (an angiotensin receptor-neprilysin inhibitor or ARNI) that is highly effective in treating heart failure by relaxing blood vessels and reducing strain on the heart.
One of the oldest anti-seizure medications, a barbiturate that works by slowing down brain activity. Still used for certain types of seizures, especially in neonates.
An essential B vitamin required for the formation of red blood cells and for preventing neural tube defects in developing babies.
An active form of Vitamin B12, essential for nerve health, brain function, and the production of red blood cells. Often used for nerve pain.
Vitamin B6 is important for normal brain development and for keeping the nervous system and immune system healthy.
An essential nutrient that acts as an antioxidant and is important for skin health, wound healing, and proper immune function.
A fat-soluble antioxidant that helps protect cells from damage. It is often found in skincare products.

medicines.active_ingredient: Vitamin A + Vitamin D + Omega-3 Fatty Acids
medicines.summary: A nutritional supplement derived from the liver of cod fish, rich in essential fatty acids and vitamins A and D.
A popular dietary supplement combination believed to help relieve joint pain and slow the degeneration of cartilage in people with osteoarthritis.
An antioxidant that your body produces naturally. It's used as a supplement for heart health and to replenish levels that may be lowered by statin medications.
